intro: Thamnosma somalensis, commonly known as the Somali thamnosma, is a flowering plant native to Somalia. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are often narrow and succulent, helping to conserve water in its native habitat. Thamnosma somalensis plays a minor role in local ecosystems but is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations.
